storyInfo: One day, Harold's prosthetic leg gets trampled by a burdenbeast. He decides to seek Rhodes Island's assistance in getting it repaired.

attributes.content: Lisburn, that shameless bastard. Calls us over to help out with herding this lot, and now him and his lady friend are nowhere to be found.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: He isn't actually thinking of settling down in Kjerag, is he? What d'you think?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Weren't you the one egging him on the hardest earlier?
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: And now you're fussing over him actually going through with it?
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: Just worried someone's trying to pull a fast one on him.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Kjerag's folk are an honest lot, and if anything shady were happening, it would be us trying to fool them. You think they're swindling Lisburn? Save it. You're just jealous.
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: You can't say that! We're soldiers! Protecting our country's our duty, and 'falling in love' must be the result of some kind of... subversive action!
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Hope you've got the energy to keep yelling like that during your next report.
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: Hope you've got the barefaced cheek to talk like that during your next report.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Just shut up and get back to herding already.
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: Hey, I'd take being a herdsman my whole life over getting sent back to the battlefield.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: As if that'll happen any time soon.
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: Don't be so sure about that. The boss got a letter from the Duke a few days ago. I dunno what's it about, but he's been murmuring to himself since he got it.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Murmuring about what?
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: 'Rhodes Island'.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Really? Only thing I've seen him worrying about lately is his prize burdenbeast. Like—
attributes.name: Somber Soldier

attributes.content: Ohoho, what a good girl! Relax, relax.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Feeble cry)
attributes.name: Docile Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Right, that's it, girl. Won't hurt a bit.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Pained cry)
attributes.name: Docile Burdenbeast

attributes.content: Now now, Lanny, stay calm, don't be afraid—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The burdenbeast in pain moves two steps towards Harold. He attempts to dodge out of the way while calming her down, but finds himself a step too slow.
'Cr-ack'.
Uh-oh.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: He looks down to see his prosthetic leg in pieces.
Hahaha!
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: Jack.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Haha... Sorry, boss. I know you're going to send me off to the hospital, so at least let me get my laughs in now while I still can?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: I am going to send you off, but not to the hospital.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: I looked into it when we first arrived. The local hospitals can't help me repair this peg-leg of mine.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Then where do I need to go?
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: I'm afraid Rhodes Island's the only place that can fix this.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Rhodes Island, huh...? I thought there's a bit of bad blood between us, though.
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: That is precisely why you must go.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: This is your last chance to not have to head back into battle, and mine to not have to go back home and deal with nobles.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Seriously? I'll be off right away then, sir!
attributes.name: Slippery Soldier

attributes.content: We've asked Engineering to have a look at your prosthetic, Mr. Craigavon.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Its inner structure was already on the verge of collapse before it got stepped on. Otherwise it wouldn't have broken with the weight of a burdenbeast.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Makes sense. It's been carrying a weight a hundred times greater than any burdenbeast, after all.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: So, what's the verdict from the experts?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I've got good news and bad news.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Good news first, if you would.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The good news is that Rhodes Island has just obtained some new equipment that will allow us to repair your prosthetic.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Let me guess, the bad news is that you don't have the material to do it?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No, our agreement with Karlan Trade covers the purchase of the material.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Then... Lack of manpower?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm afraid so. The technology in your prosthetic is rather advanced, and none of our operators currently in Kjerag have the technical know-how.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: What a pity.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: *sigh* After so many years enjoying its retirement, it seems I must put my cane back to its original use.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: We do have someone from Engineering currently traveling Kjerag.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: She's on holiday, though, and she hasn't been in touch with our office since she arrived, so we're not entirely sure what her itinerary looks like.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: If we can find her, she might be able to help you.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: A hunt it is, then. I'll do it. Got any leads for me?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hmm... Courier mentioned passing some goods over to her friends. He might know something.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Courier, that would be Weiss...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: This puts me in a bit of a pickle.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: If it's not convenient for you—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: No, I'll go.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: But your leg—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Not to worry. I am rather accustomed to walking with my cane. It's been my firm friend for about as long as that metal leg has.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I told him, as per your request, Mr. SilverAsh. He really did go off by himself. Is that everything, then?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Yes. I've discussed it with the Doctor.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Since he wants to use this opportunity to get closer to Rhodes Island, why, we are merely riding his coattails.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: He will not be ignorant of this.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: The rest is all up to him.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Oh, I see you've come again today, Mr. Weiss.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: Yep. I'll be following Sir Enciodes to Rhodes Island soon, so I decided to help out here a bit more often before I'm off.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Oh, that's wonderful to hear!
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: Ah, right, there's an elderly gentleman who's been waiting for you for quite a while now.
attributes.name: Station Staff

attributes.content: An elderly gentleman?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Long time no see, Mr. Weiss.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It's been quite some time, Lord Viscount.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I thought you would have left Kjerag by now.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Haha, you are such a jocular young fellow, Weiss. Surely my every movement is under your watchful eye, no?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You know that my master has long since called off surveillance on you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'm happy for the free time myself. At least I don't have to worry about getting knocked silly.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You're a very straightforward young man. I must say, I much prefer dealing with people like you.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: So, why do you need me, all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Well, you see, I'm currently looking for one of Rhodes Island's master engineers to see if she can help repair my prosthetic.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I've heard you know where she's gone off to.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I think I know who you're talking about.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I know, I know, it won't be so easy for me to get information out of you.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I've talked it over with the staff here. How about I help you send your letters once my leg's all fixed up, hmm?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Forgive me. I cannot give out information regarding a Rhodes Island operator to a Victorian officer so lightly.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Bah, figured it wouldn't be quite so easy.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm afraid I'll have to ask Jack and the other lads to run around looking for her.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: *sigh* No, that won't work. They'll just lead to a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Harold & Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: Oh? What's going on here, young lady?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: *sigh*... It's nothing, just that the stress of work's too much for me.
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: I don't think I can take much more of it, but I can't afford to lose this job, either.
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: I'm afraid there's much in life out of our control, madam.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Today's a rare day off for me, but I don't feel happy. Even on vacation, all I can do is sit here like some kind of fool.
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: What joy is there in a life like this?
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Young lady, would you happen to be interested in dance?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Somewhat, I guess.
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: Then, how about admiring a disabled old fogey dancing a jig?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Huh? But... your leg...?
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: Who said you can't dance with one leg, eh?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Harold says no more. With his cane in hand, he steps in front of the young woman, giving her a bow befitting a gentleman.
Huh?
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: As she gasps in surprise, Harold begins to dance, waving his cane this way and that.
First, he revolves around it, his foot moving with grace and aplomb.
His cane and his leather shoe rap against the ground, their rhythm a perfect match with the music being played in the nearby stores.

But the best has yet to come. As the music reaches its crescendo, he flings his cane into the air. It spins, spins, spins, before he deftly catches it like the most graceful of acrobats, all as the woman claps and cheers.
It seems she too has caught the dance bug as she joins him, and together they dance merrily on the street.
Passersby are unwittingly drawn in by Harold's magnetic energy. Some are happy to stand on the sidelines and applaud, while others join in with gusto.
The plaza has found itself the epicenter of festivity.
Better to join in and look a fool than sit out and be a bore, as I always say!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You're right!
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: As the music slowly draws to a close, Harold intends to use one last beautiful toss of his cane to serve as his curtain call.
But—
(Now? Of all times?)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Perhaps it's due to lack of practice, or perhaps the lively atmosphere got to his head, but at the very last second, his hand slips.
The cane traces a beautiful arc in the air, but its destination is far from his reach.
Uh-oh.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: As if refusing to let the show end on such a dour note, a figure streaks across the plaza like lightning, lightly tapping the cane in midair.
The cane changes its trajectory, falling gently into Harold's hand.
And with that, he bows once more. The show is over.
He takes in the thunderous applause.
Do you think I could be like you one day, sir?
attributes.name: Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: Now why would you ever want to be like me, young lady? You've got two good legs, a beautiful face, and plenty of time.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You'll be even better than me, guaranteed.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'll try my best. Thank you.
attributes.name: No-Longer-Depressed Passerby

attributes.content: It has been a privilege to impart some courage unto a young soul such as yours, madam.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Now then... How long have you been watching, Madam Degenbrecher?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I spotted you while I was enjoying a meal nearby.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: You dance well.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: *sigh* Yes, well, if one is to hobnob around the upper echelons of society, one must put in some effort.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Some nobles were fond of hiding my leg for a laugh, so I put my nose to the grindstone with the help of my wife.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Nowadays, Old Harold's One-Legged Dance could be considered my calling card.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: What happened to your leg?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Haha, my prosthetic fell in the line of duty. As for why, I'm sure you can guess.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I see... It must have been of good quality to last so long.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: It's beyond repair?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Only one of Rhodes Island's technical experts can fix it, but Mr. Weiss doesn't feel like telling me where she is. So what other choice have I but to sigh in sorrow here in the plaza?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Are you sighing because you can't find the engineer, or because you can't get a relationship going with Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Madam Degenbrecher, you would be a most terrifying presence to encounter on a social call.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm not interested in your parties.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: But since you have time on your hands...
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Kolod.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: What is it, ma'am?
attributes.name: Bulky Youth

attributes.content: Your dad needs men to help sow seeds this afternoon, correct?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Tell Matterhorn that this Victorian veteran will come and help.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Wait, Matterhorn... This might end up being a golden opportunity.)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Moreover, I'll have to face him down sooner or later anyhow.)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Bulky Youth

attributes.content: Are you going or not?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Of course I am.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I find I am compelled to repeat myself.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Madam Degenbrecher, you would be a most terrifying presence to encounter on a social call.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Degenbrecher said Sir Enciodes asked her for help, but she's too busy, and she sent this man instead?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Yep.
attributes.name: Bulky Youth

attributes.content: It's been a rather long time, Mr. Matterhorn.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I won't ask too many questions. You know your farm work?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: But of course! Whenever I have the time, I head down to the fields on my land myself to help out the farmers.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Those fields might be my closest friends.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Good to hear.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Ah, however, do wait a moment, if you could.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: If it's fieldwork, this cane will just get in the way.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'd like to borrow a couple of things from you to fashion a simple leg.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: What do you need?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Some wood, a knife, some cotton, and a length of rope. Nothing too difficult.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You can make a prosthetic out of that?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Matterhorn is somewhat incredulous, but Harold gets to work like he's done it a thousand times before.
He starts with a cylindrical piece of wood, measuring out the length of his missing limb, before shaving both ends of the log flat to use as his 'leg'.
Then, he finds a round, flat piece of wood, bores a hole through the middle, and inserts the 'leg' through it. And with that, he has finished his simple-as-can-be 'prosthetic'.
I'm guessing you've made ones like those before?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: The army gives out proper ones, of course, but battlefield conditions are fickle. If something goes wrong with yours, there's no repairing it in the middle of combat.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Times like that, a simple yet practical prosthetic such as this will suffice for marching.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Moreover, a proper prosthetic isn't cheap. Especially not for a serviceman, who will ask a lot more out of one compared to a civilian.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: As he speaks, Harold carves some wood into a bowl shape, filling the inside with cotton.
He then puts the bowl flush against the wooden 'leg' and ties them together with rope, finishing it off with an incredibly tight knot.
He stands, then takes a couple of steps before making a circle. To top it all off, he bows to Matterhorn. Mission successful, it seems.
It is a somewhat comical scene, but Matterhorn can't help but applaud.
I have another one of these handmade prosthetics back at home. Whenever it's time to head down to the fields, on it goes.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: After all, the one I normally use has a terribly high price tag. Not that it's unworthy of it. It's lasted me many years, with nary a peep out of it.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'd often joke with my men that if aught were to happen to me in battle, save my leg first!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It's worth more than any compensation I'd get.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Do you have many fields back home?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: We do.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: But not like Kjerag's. The ones at home are awash with golden wheat.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: But I'd say there's still plenty the same. Wouldn't you say so, my good sir?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hnnf—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I believe that's the last of it.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It is.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: As the sun sinks into the west, Harold, Matterhorn and the farmers stand between the fields to look at the results of their afternoon's work. As one, they let out a deep breath.
Work like this always gets one puffing out the chest, eh, Matterhorn?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You're right. I never did expect to share a moment like this with a Victorian noble like you.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Haha! Well, don't expect anything like that out of any others, or you'll be sorely disappointed.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: How did you become a noble, then?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: A very good question.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It's like how every member of the Caster family is sighing and asking why your Sir Enciodes had to be born a man of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: We may never have a proper answer. All we can do is treat it as a jest of fate.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Do let your master know that the next time he is in our county, he must give me a ring.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'll ask my wife to personally man the kitchen and prepare a taste of Victorian home cooking for you all.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Then you and him can stay with us a spell.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: And when the time comes, we can send you off with some rousing local tunes—
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Harold starts to hum softly.
The farmers by their side begin to accompany him with the folk songs of Kjerag.
Before they knew it, it had become a chorus amidst the fields, blending together songs of Victoria and Kjerag both.
Seems things are rather lively today.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Oh, Weiss! Delivering letters again, are we?
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The song they're singing sounds familiar, but also a bit not, if you get me?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Some old Victorian's singing along with them.
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: Still sounds pretty good, though.
attributes.name: Bystander Villager

attributes.content: An old Victorian?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Weiss follows the singing, only to find Harold counting out a beat as a local farmer sings.
His face works its way through several different expressions before finally settling on calmness.
I could say a couple of words to Weiss on your behalf, but I can't guarantee he'll listen.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: This is just how he is. I hope you understand.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: I was even more difficult to deal with when I was his age.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: It seems you won't need my help.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Wha-?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Mr. Weiss.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: If you had known that things were going to end the way they did, then why did you feel the need to keep up the pretense?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Mr. Weiss, a soldier can never in clear conscience ask his victims for forgiveness.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: All I can say is...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I really do love Kjerag.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: If possible, I'd like to wish her all the best. I'm thinking of bringing my whole family here to have a look around in future.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I just happened to pass by on the way to deliver something to that Rhodes Island engineer.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You can come along, assuming you can keep up.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Weiss turns and walks away.
But he does not leap and bound into the distance as usual. Instead, he walks, at a speed somewhat faster than an ordinary man, heading towards the snowy mountains.
Weiss is also struggling inside.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Hah! Who isn't?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm struggling too. But for me, it's more like how my stump will ache from time to time.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It's not something I tell others often...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Not that anybody really cares in the first place.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Well then. Be seeing you, Matterhorn, my good man.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hmm? Wait, Sir Harold.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: My master has just notified me that he will be holding a banquet in a few days, and he cordially extends you an invitation. Weiss, Degenbrecher and I will also be in attendance.
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: So that's how it is.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Pardon?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: It seems I owe a favor not just to Madam Degenbrecher, but to Sir Enciodes as well.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (I just wanted to use this opportunity to establish a rapport with Rhodes Island at first, but from the looks of things, I suppose I can even hand in my onboard application tomorrow.)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (The wandering engineer was your handiwork, wasn't it, Enciodes?)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: (Ah, no, can't quite say that for sure. All I can say is that we're of like mind. Me going to Rhodes Island will be a good thing for you, me, Kjerag and Caster.)
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Sir Harold?
attributes.name: Matterhorn

attributes.content: Do tell him that I'll be bringing some top-notch liquor with me! We'll drink till we drop!
attributes.name: Harold
